event.reason: Step to the Prisma DB schema generation after requirements analysis

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

models.description:
User activity tracking table - This implements business requirements related to user interaction tracking and rate limiting.

Tracks all user actions including posts, comments, and content moderation interactions. Maintains 3NF compliance by normalizing user activity from user identity and content storage. For example, used to calculate user reputation scores and detect patterned abuse.

Key relationships: References users table for user identification
Special behaviors: Prevents rate limiting by recording activity timestamps

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of activity creation - Implements rate limiting enforcement requirements.

For example, used to determine activity volume within time windows specified in natural language terms for business continuity. Ensures normalization by maintaining temporal sequence.

plainFields.name: activity_type
plainFields.description:
Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

models.name: discussion_board_user_activity

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

models.name: discussion_board_user_patterns

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

foreignFields.name: activity_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to triggering activity record - Implements traceability requirements for pattern analysis.

plainFields.name: up
plainFields.description: Whether the upvote was eventually approved by moderation

plainFields.name: down
plainFields.description: Whether the downvote was eventually approved by moderation

plainFields.name: initial_hit_detected
plainFields.description: Whether profanity was detected at initial submission

plainFields.name: update_count
plainFields.description: Number of times this vote was updated

models.description: Upvotes Board Objects Model - This implements the Interaction Dynamics for Discussion Board Users from the business requirements document. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating upvote relationships while preserving moderation history. For example, tracks user upvotes on discussions and comments. Special behaviors include IP tracking and voting patterns analysis. Key relationships: Connects users to their upvoted content.

Maintains 3NF compliance through association with users and target discussion entities while preserving voting patterns. For example, connects users to their downvotes with associated analytics. Special behaviors include automatic flagging thresholds and voting pattern analysis. Key relationships: Links voters to their downvotes and associated content.

models.description:
Main discussion thread storage implementing content creation requirements. Each record represents a complete discussion thread with moderation metadata.

Key relationships: Author identity link to users (1:N), Media assets (1:N), Category scope (N:1), Snapshots (1:N), Archives (1:1 if active)

Special behaviors: 1. Triggers content mailbox notifications 2. Maintains markdown history 3. Enforces content length validation 4. Tracks version history

plainFields.description: Media content type specification, e.g., 'image/jpeg', 'video/mp4'. Ensures format validation operates correctly.

plainFields.name: size_bytes
plainFields.description: Media file size in bytes for storage integrity checks. Must be under 10MB compliance threshold.

plainFields.name: uploaded_at

models.description:
Discussion thread media storage implementing content creation rules for file attachments. Each record represents media asset attached to a specific discussion.

Special behaviors: 1. Image content moderation analysis 2. Enforces file size constraints 3. Tracks storage compliance metadata.

models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

models.description: Automated moderation rule configurations with version history. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (creation workflow), non-functional security requirements (SOC 2 compliance through version tracking), and technical specifications (500 character limit enforcement). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating policy rules from their technical implementation. For example, when configuring automated moderation rules per category.

User activity tracking table - This implements business requirements related to user interaction tracking and rate limiting.

Tracks all user actions including posts, comments, and content moderation interactions. Maintains 3NF compliance by normalizing user activity from user identity and content storage. For example, used to calculate user reputation scores and detect patterned abuse.

Key relationships: References users table for user identification
Special behaviors: Prevents rate limiting by recording activity timestamps

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of activity creation - Implements rate limiting enforcement requirements.

For example, used to determine activity volume within time windows specified in natural language terms for business continuity. Ensures normalization by maintaining temporal sequence.

plainFields.name: activity_type
plainFields.description:
Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

plainFields.description: Media asset URL implementing content creation rules for media validation (format/size). For example, 'https://media.service/threads/abc123.jpg'.

plainFields.description: Media content type specification, e.g., 'image/jpeg', 'video/mp4'. Ensures format validation operates correctly.

plainFields.name: size_bytes
plainFields.description: Media file size in bytes for storage integrity checks. Must be under 10MB compliance threshold.

plainFields.description: File upload timestamp for storage management and content validity tracking.

foreignFields.description: Target discussion's {\\@link discussion_board_discussions.id}

models.description:
Discussion thread media storage implementing content creation rules for file attachments. Each record represents media asset attached to a specific discussion.

Key relationships: Media linkage to threads (N:1). Main media repository for all supported file types.

Special behaviors: 1. Image content moderation analysis 2. Enforces file size constraints 3. Tracks storage compliance metadata.

models.name: discussion_board_categories

plainFields.name: name

plainFields.description: Category purpose documentation for moderator reference. Implements moderated content classification rules.

plainFields.name: thread_count
plainFields.description: Tracking metadata for category management metrics. Business logic maintained by materialized views.

plainFields.name: active
plainFields.description: Category availability flag for administrative control. Enables content scope management.

models.description:
Discussion timestamp categories organizing content management domains. Each record represents unique scope classification.

Key relationships: Thread organization (1:N), Moderator assignments (not implemented here), Version history (1:N)

Special behaviors: 1. Thread count maintenance logic 2. Active state governance 3. Category structure management

models.description:
Discussion content version history tracking implementing content moderation rules. Each record represents one version state of a discussion.

Key relationships: Version history chain (previous pointer), Discussion linkage (parent reference)

Special behaviors: 1. Content change tracking 2. Version rollback capability 3. Forensic history database

Auto-archived discussion storage implementing data retention requirements. Each record represents thread content that has passed 180-day threshold.

Special behaviors: 1. Hides content from user view 2. Maintains database integrity 3. Stores historical records

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

plainFields.name: up
plainFields.description: Whether the upvote was eventually approved by moderation

plainFields.name: down
plainFields.description: Whether the downvote was eventually approved by moderation

plainFields.name: initial_hit_detected
plainFields.description: Whether profanity was detected at initial submission

plainFields.name: update_count
plainFields.description: Number of times this vote was updated

Key relationships: References discussion_board_users and discussion_board_moderators.

Maintains 3NF compliance by separating upvote relationships while preserving moderation history. For example, tracks user upvotes on discussions and comments. Special behaviors include IP tracking and voting patterns analysis. Key relationships: Connects users to their upvoted content.

models.description: Downvotes Board Model - This implements the Content Moderation Mechanics from the business requirements document. Special behaviors include automatic flagging thresholds and voting pattern analysis. Key relationships: Links voters to their downvotes and associated content.

models.description: Automated moderation rule configurations with version history. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (creation workflow), non-functional security requirements (SOC 2 compliance through version tracking), and technical specifications (500 character limit enforcement). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating policy rules from their technical implementation. For example, when configuring automated moderation rules per category.

User activity tracking table - This implements business requirements related to user interaction tracking and rate limiting.

Tracks all user actions including posts, comments, and content moderation interactions. Maintains 3NF compliance by normalizing user activity from user identity and content storage. For example, used to calculate user reputation scores and detect patterned abuse.

Key relationships: References users table for user identification
Special behaviors: Prevents rate limiting by recording activity timestamps

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of activity creation - Implements rate limiting enforcement requirements.

For example, used to determine activity volume within time windows specified in natural language terms for business continuity. Ensures normalization by maintaining temporal sequence.

plainFields.name: activity_type
plainFields.description:
Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

models.name: discussion_board_user_activity

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

models.name: discussion_board_user_patterns

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

foreignFields.name: activity_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to triggering activity record - Implements traceability requirements for pattern analysis.

models.name: discussion_board_configurations
models.description: System-wide configuration parameters - This implements the requirements from the system_rel section of the requirements document. Implements business requirements for system-wide control parameters, maintains 3NF compliance by separating configuration data from runtime data, and provides versioned history through snapshots. For example, stores system-wide settings like site title, default theme, and operational thresholds.

models.description: Automated moderation rule configurations with version history. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (creation workflow), non-functional security requirements (SOC 2 compliance through version tracking), and technical specifications (500 character limit enforcement). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating policy rules from their technical implementation. For example, when configuring automated moderation rules per category.

User activity tracking table - This implements business requirements related to user interaction tracking and rate limiting.

Tracks all user actions including posts, comments, and content moderation interactions. Maintains 3NF compliance by normalizing user activity from user identity and content storage. For example, used to calculate user reputation scores and detect patterned abuse.

Key relationships: References users table for user identification
Special behaviors: Prevents rate limiting by recording activity timestamps

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of activity creation - Implements rate limiting enforcement requirements.

For example, used to determine activity volume within time windows specified in natural language terms for business continuity. Ensures normalization by maintaining temporal sequence.

plainFields.name: activity_type
plainFields.description:
Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

models.name: discussion_board_user_activity

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

models.name: discussion_board_user_patterns

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

foreignFields.name: activity_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to triggering activity record - Implements traceability requirements for pattern analysis.

event.planning:
## Error Scope
- Target Models: 8 models contain validation errors
- Unchanged Models: All other models remain in original schema

## Targeted Fixes
1. discussion_board_login_attempts:
   - Remove duplicate 'user_id' plain field
2. discussion_board_moderators:
   - Remove duplicate 'user_id' plain index (keep unique index)
3. discussion_board_user_reputation:
   - Remove invalid 'reputation_score' index
4. discussion_board_upvotes:
   - Add missing 'subject_id' and 'subject_type' fields
5. discussion_board_downvotes:
   - Add missing 'subject_id' and 'subject_type' fields
   - Remove 'created_at' from plain indexes (not a field)
6. discussion_board_banned_users:
   - Remove invalid 'ban_appeal_id' relation

## Output Scope
- Return: 6 error models with corrected fields and indexes
- Preserve: All other models unchanged

## Cross-Model Impact
- Ensure 'subject_type' and 'subject_id' are correctly referenced in upvotes/downvotes
- No changes needed in other models referencing these

models.description: Automated moderation rule configurations with version history. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (creation workflow), non-functional security requirements (SOC 2 compliance through version tracking), and technical specifications (500 character limit enforcement). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating policy rules from their technical implementation. For example, when configuring automated moderation rules per category.

User activity tracking table - This implements business requirements related to user interaction tracking and rate limiting.

Tracks all user actions including posts, comments, and content moderation interactions. Maintains 3NF compliance by normalizing user activity from user identity and content storage. For example, used to calculate user reputation scores and detect patterned abuse.

Key relationships: References users table for user identification
Special behaviors: Prevents rate limiting by recording activity timestamps

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of activity creation - Implements rate limiting enforcement requirements.

For example, used to determine activity volume within time windows specified in natural language terms for business continuity. Ensures normalization by maintaining temporal sequence.

plainFields.name: activity_type
plainFields.description:
Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

models.name: discussion_board_user_activity

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

Type of activity recorded (post, comment, flag, etc.) - Implements category-based moderation rules.

For example, differentiates voting patterns for reputation scoring calculations. Ensures normalization by separating activity classification from instance data.

plainFields.name: action_count
plainFields.description:
Number of actions within this activity record - Implements pattern detection requirements.

For example, tracks comment bursts per owner's EARS specification regarding behavioral thresholds. Ensures normalization by aggregating related actions.

models.name: discussion_board_user_activity

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user traceability requirements for moderation need.

models.description:
User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Tracks detected patterns of user activity that may indicate coordinated behavior or policy violations. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating pattern detection events from raw activity data.

Key relationships: Links activity patterns to specific users
Special behaviors: Enforces progressive warning count thresholds

plainFields.name: pattern_type
plainFields.description:
Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.

For example, identifies burst commenting patterns or coordinated voting behavior for enforcement thresholds calculation.

plainFields.name: confidence_score
plainFields.description:
System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.

For example, determines if pattern should trigger immediate warning or require manual verification based on calculated thresholds.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.

For example, used in pattern recurrence analysis as specified in system SLA milestones.

plainFields.name: trigger_count
plainFields.description:
Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.

For example, determines if automated warning count should increase per business rule specification about moderator productivity targets.

models.name: discussion_board_user_patterns

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link discussion_board_users.id} - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.

foreignFields.name: activity_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to triggering activity record - Implements traceability requirements for pattern analysis.

models.description:
Main discussion thread storage implementing content creation requirements. Each record represents a complete discussion thread with moderation metadata.

Key relationships: Author identity link to users (1:N), Media assets (1:N), Category scope (N:1), Snapshots (1:N), Archives (1:1 if active)

Special behaviors: 1. Triggers content mailbox notifications 2. Maintains markdown history 3. Enforces content length validation 4. Tracks version history

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

event.planning:
## Error Scope
- Target Models: discussion_board_login_attempts, discussion_board_user_profiles, discussion_board_user_reputation, discussion_board_downvotes, discussion_board_banned_users, discussion_board_reports, discussion_board_moderation_queue, discussion_board_upvotes, discussion_board_user_activity, discussion_board_user_patterns (10 models only)

## Targeted Fixes
- discussion_board_login_attempts: Remove duplicate plainField 'user_id'
- discussion_board_user_profiles: Remove duplicate plainIndex on 'user_id'
- discussion_board_user_reputation: Fix index referencing non-existent field
- discussion_board_downvotes, discussion_board_upvotes: Add missing 'subject_id' and 'subject_type' fields
- discussion_board_banned_users: Fix GIN index on non-string field 'reason_timestamp'

## Output Scope
- Return: Only validated error models

## Cross-Model Impact
- Verify: All model relations remain valid

models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

event.planning:
## Error Scope
- Target Models: discussion_board_user_reputation, discussion_board_upvotes, discussion_board_downvotes, discussion_board_banned_users, discussion_board_user_activity (5 models)

## Targeted Fixes
1. discussion_board_user_reputation: Added 'reputation_score' plain field
2. discussion_board_upvotes: Added 'subject_id' (uuid) and 'subject_type' (string) for indexing
3. discussion_board_downvotes: Added 'subject_id' (uuid) and 'subject_type' (string) for indexing
4. discussion_board_banned_users: Removed invalid GIN index on 'reason_timestamp' (datetime)
5. discussion_board_user_activity: Fixed index referencing 'user_id' to 'discussion_board_user_id'

## Output Scope
- Return: All 5 models with validation fixes
- Preserve: All models not mentioned in error array in original schema

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

models.description:

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

Maintains 3NF compliance by removing multiple reporting instances in favor of consolidated report cases with rich metadata. For example, when content is flagged by a user, the system creates an entry here with content extracts.

models.name: discussion_board_configurations
models.description: System-wide configuration parameters - This implements the requirements from the system_rel section of the requirements document. Implements business requirements for system-wide control parameters, maintains 3NF compliance by separating configuration data from runtime data, and provides versioned history through snapshots. For example, stores system-wide settings like site title, default theme, and operational thresholds.

plainFields.name: value
plainFields.description: Current value for this configuration key. Maintains 3NF purity by storing a single value.

event.planning:
## Error Scope
- Target Models: discussion_board_downvotes (1 model only)
- Unchanged Models: All other models remain in original schema

## Targeted Fixes
- discussion_board_downvotes: Add missing foreign key field 'discussion_board_user_id' referencing 'discussion_board_users', and ensure unique index references existing fields

## Output Scope
- Return: Only discussion_board_downvotes model
- Preserve: All other models unchanged in original schema

## Cross-Model Impact
- Verify: discussion_board_downvotes now correctly references discussion_board_users
- No changes needed in other models referencing these

models.description: System-wide configuration parameters - This implements the requirements from the system_rel section of the requirements document. For example, stores system-wide settings like site title, default theme, and operational thresholds.

models.description:
Main discussion thread storage implementing content creation requirements. Each record represents a complete discussion thread with moderation metadata.

Key relationships: Author identity link to users (1:N), Media assets (1:N), Category scope (N:1), Snapshots (1:N), Archives (1:1 if active)

Special behaviors: 1. Triggers content mailbox notifications 2. Maintains markdown history 3. Enforces content length validation 4. Tracks version history

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description:
[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

# Prisma Markdown

> Generated by [`prisma-markdown`](https://github.com/samchon/prisma-markdown)

- [Systematic](#systematic)
- [Actors](#actors)
- [Discussion](#discussion)
- [Comments](#comments)
- [Voting](#voting)
- [Moderation](#moderation)
- [Activity](#activity)

## Systematic

```mermaid
erDiagram
"discussion_board_configurations" {
  String id PK
  String key UK
  String description
  String value
  DateTime created_at
  DateTime updated_at
}
"discussion_board_rate_limits" {
  String id PK
  String resource_type UK
  Int per_minute_limit
  Int per_hour_limit
  Int per_day_limit
  DateTime created_at
  DateTime updated_at
}
"discussion_board_login_attempts" {
  String id PK
  String user_id FK
  String ip_address
  DateTime created_at
  Boolean success
  String user_agent
}
```

### `discussion_board_configurations`

System-wide configuration parameters - This implements the requirements from the system_rel section of the requirements document. Implements business requirements for system-wide control parameters, maintains 3NF compliance by separating configuration data from runtime data, and provides versioned history through snapshots. For example, stores system-wide settings like site title, default theme, and operational thresholds.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `key`: Configuration key name implementing site configuration parameters. Maintains 3NF by ensuring atomic values. For example, "site.title", "theme.default".
- `description`: Human-readable explanation about this configuration. Ensures requirement traceability by documenting implementation context.
- `value`: Current value for this configuration key. Maintains 3NF purity by storing a single value.
- `created_at`: Timestamp when configuration was first created.
- `updated_at`: Timestamp when configuration was last updated.

### `discussion_board_rate_limits`

Rate limiting policies for system protection - This implements the automated moderation requirements from the requirements document. Enforces system reliability requirements by controlling request rates. Maintains 3NF compliance by storing rate limit parameters in atomic form, separate from runtime enforcement.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `resource_type`: Identifier for the protected resource (e.g., 'login', 'api.post', 'api.comment'). Ensures requirement compliance by tracking API categories.
- `per_minute_limit`: Maximum allowed requests per minute for this resource. Implements requirement SLA for rate limiting.
- `per_hour_limit`: Maximum allowed requests per hour for this resource. Provides different time scale enforcement.
- `per_day_limit`: Maximum allowed requests per day for this resource. Ensures long-term system stability.
- `created_at`: Timestamp when policy was created.
- `updated_at`: Timestamp when policy was last updated.

### `discussion_board_login_attempts`

Security audit trail for authentication events - Implements the security requirements from the requirements document. Tracks user authentication attempts for pattern analysis. Maintains 3NF compliance by storing login events atomically.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `user_id`: Target user's [discussion_board_users.id](#discussion_board_users) for audit
- `ip_address`: Client IP address during login attempt. Ensures security tracing capability.
- `created_at`: Attempt timestamp with microsecond precision
- `success`: Login attempt success status
- `user_agent`: Client User-Agent string. Not included in login attempt success tracking.

## Actors

```mermaid
erDiagram
"discussion_board_users" {
  String id PK
  String email UK
  String password_hash
  String verification_status
  String registered_ip
  String status
  DateTime two_factor_enabled_at "nullable"
  DateTime created_at
}
"discussion_board_user_profiles" {
  String id PK
  String user_id FK,UK
  String language
  DateTime updated_at
  String display_name
  String theme
}
"discussion_board_moderators" {
  String id PK
  String user_id FK,UK
  String permissions
  DateTime action_window_start
  DateTime action_window_end
  DateTime effective_date
  DateTime updated_at
}
"discussion_board_admins" {
  String id PK
  String user_id FK,UK
  String admin_credentials UK
  DateTime max_session_duration
  String required_auth_level
  Boolean compromised_status
  DateTime credential_refresh_at
}
"discussion_board_user_profiles" |o--|| "discussion_board_users" : user
"discussion_board_moderators" |o--|| "discussion_board_users" : user
"discussion_board_admins" |o--|| "discussion_board_users" : user
```

### `discussion_board_users`

User account base information - Implements user account creation, verification, and basic access controls from business requirements. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating authentication data from profile information.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `email`: User's verified email address used for notifications
- `password_hash`: Hashed password for secure authentication
- `verification_status`: Email verification status (unverified, verified, pending_reverification)
- `registered_ip`: IP address used during account creation
- `status`: Account status: active, suspended, or deleted
- `two_factor_enabled_at`: Two-factor authentication activation date if enabled
- `created_at`: Time when account was created

### `discussion_board_user_profiles`

User profile information including display information and settings - Implements user identity management requirements with strict GDPR compliance.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `user_id`: Targeted user's {\@link discussion_board_users.id}
- `language`: Selected interface language preference
- `updated_at`: Last timestamp when profile was updated
- `display_name`: Display name within the platform
- `theme`: Dark/light mode preference

### `discussion_board_moderators`

Moderator permissions tier with scope boundaries - Implements enterprise-grade moderation controls and privilege segmentation.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `user_id`: Targeted user's {\@link discussion_board_users.id}
- `permissions`: Permissions available to this moderator tier
- `action_window_start`: Time window limit for moderation actions
- `action_window_end`: Time window limit for moderation actions
- `effective_date`: Effective date for this moderator configuration
- `updated_at`: Last timestamp when permissions were updated

### `discussion_board_admins`

Administrative privileges and enterprise configuration access.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key
- `user_id`: Targeted user's [discussion_board_users.id](#discussion_board_users)
- `admin_credentials`: Enterprise management credentials
- `max_session_duration`: Maximum access duration for admin sessions
- `required_auth_level`: Required authentication level for entry
- `compromised_status`: Status of account compromise verification
- `credential_refresh_at`: Last timestamp for credentials refresh

## Discussion

```mermaid
erDiagram
"discussion_board_discussions" {
  String id PK
  String discussion_board_user_id FK
  String discussion_board_category_id FK
  String title
  String content
  DateTime created_at
  DateTime updated_at
  DateTime archived_at "nullable"
}
"discussion_board_discussion_media" {
  String id PK
  String discussion_board_discussion_id FK
  String(80000) url
  String type
  Int size_bytes
  DateTime uploaded_at
}
"discussion_board_categories" {
  String id PK
  String name UK
  String description
  Int thread_count
  Boolean active
}
"discussion_board_discussion_snapshots" {
  String id PK
  String discussion_board_discussion_id FK
  String previous_snapshot_id FK,UK "nullable"
  String title
  String content
  DateTime created_at
}
"discussion_board_discussion_archives" {
  String id PK
  String discussion_board_discussion_id FK,UK
  String archived_by_id FK "nullable"
  DateTime archived_at
  String title
  String content
  DateTime restored_at "nullable"
}
"discussion_board_discussions" }o--|| "discussion_board_categories" : category
"discussion_board_discussion_media" }o--|| "discussion_board_discussions" : discussion
"discussion_board_discussion_snapshots" }o--|| "discussion_board_discussions" : discussion
"discussion_board_discussion_snapshots" |o--o| "discussion_board_discussion_snapshots" : previous
"discussion_board_discussion_archives" |o--|| "discussion_board_discussions" : discussion
```

### `discussion_board_discussions`

Main discussion thread storage implementing content creation requirements. Each record represents a complete discussion thread with moderation metadata.

Key relationships: Author identity link to users (1:N), Media assets (1:N), Category scope (N:1), Snapshots (1:N), Archives (1:1 if active)

Special behaviors: 1. Triggers content mailbox notifications 2. Maintains markdown history 3. Enforces content length validation 4. Tracks version history

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: Creating user's {\\@link discussion_board_users.id}. Required 3rd party account
- `discussion_board_category_id`: Scope category's pre-existing {\\@link discussion_board_categories.id}
- `title`: Discussion board's title, Implements content creation rule: '5000 character limit' and 'Markdown formatting allowed'. Business meaning: Thread's headline.
- `content`: Discussion content implementing content creation rules for profanity checks and markdown. For example, '## Technical Analysis\n\`code\` block section\n!*image.png*' format.
- `created_at`: Content creation timestamp for moderation rules requiring audit logs. Enables content visibility tracking.
- `updated_at`: Content modification timestamp for version history compliance. Ensures versioning visibility.
- `archived_at`: When content crosses 180-day threshold per acceptance criteria. Maintains database integrity by soft archive.

### `discussion_board_discussion_media`

Discussion thread media storage implementing content creation rules for file attachments. Each record represents media asset attached to a specific discussion.

Key relationships: Media linkage to threads (N:1). Main media repository for all supported file types.

Special behaviors: 1. Image content moderation analysis 2. Enforces file size constraints 3. Tracks storage compliance metadata.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_discussion_id`: Target discussion's {\\@link discussion_board_discussions.id}
- `url`: Media asset URL implementing content creation rules for media validation (format/size). For example, 'https://media.service/threads/abc123.jpg'.
- `type`: Media content type specification, e.g., 'image/jpeg', 'video/mp4'. Ensures format validation operates correctly.
- `size_bytes`: Media file size in bytes for storage integrity checks. Must be under 10MB compliance threshold.
- `uploaded_at`: File upload timestamp for storage management and content validity tracking.

### `discussion_board_categories`

Discussion timestamp categories organizing content management domains. Each record represents unique scope classification.

Key relationships: Thread organization (1:N), Moderator assignments (not implemented here), Version history (1:N)

Special behaviors: 1. Thread count maintenance logic 2. Active state governance 3. Category structure management

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `name`: Category classification name implementing nutritional requirements. For example, 'Technical Discussion', 'Support Requests'.
- `description`: Category purpose documentation for moderator reference. Implements moderated content classification rules.
- `thread_count`: Tracking metadata for category management metrics. Business logic maintained by materialized views.
- `active`: Category availability flag for administrative control. Enables content scope management.

### `discussion_board_discussion_snapshots`

Discussion content version history tracking implementing content moderation rules. Each record represents one version state of a discussion.

Key relationships: Version history chain (previous pointer), Discussion linkage (parent reference)

Special behaviors: 1. Content change tracking 2. Version rollback capability 3. Forensic history database

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_discussion_id`: Original discussion's {\\@link discussion_board_discussions.id}
- `previous_snapshot_id`: Previous snapshot's {\\@link discussion_board_discussion_snapshots.id} for version tracking
- `title`: Historic thread title at snapshot creation time. Enables version comparison.
- `content`: Historic content version implementing moderation history requirements. Provides diff comparisons.
- `created_at`: Snapshot creation timestamp for version history tracking. Important for compliance audits.

### `discussion_board_discussion_archives`

Auto-archived discussion storage implementing data retention requirements. Each record represents thread content that has passed 180-day threshold.

Key relationships: Permanent link to original thread (1:1), Operator tracking (N:1 if admin involved), Restoration records (not implemented directly)

Special behaviors: 1. Hides content from user view 2. Maintains database integrity 3. Stores historical records

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_discussion_id`: Original discussion's {\\@link discussion_board_discussions.id}
- `archived_by_id`: Archive operator's {\\@link discussion_board_admins.id} when content crosses auto-archive threshold
- `archived_at`: Content auto-archive timestamp implementing 180-day retention period requirement.
- `title`: Archived content title for reference purposes. Maintains WHOIS history tracking.
- `content`: Historical content archive implementing data retention rules. Content remains existent but hidden.
- `restored_at`: When content undergoes restoration process from archive status. Admin-level operation.

## Comments

```mermaid
erDiagram
"discussion_board_comments" {
  String id PK
  String discussion_board_user_id FK
  String discussion_board_discussion_id FK
  String content
  DateTime created_at
  DateTime updated_at
}
```

### `discussion_board_comments`

[Comment entity] - This implements the 'CREATE discussion threads with rich media' requirement from the requirements document.

[Basic user can create comments] - Enables discussion participation with content creation. Maintains 3NF compliance by separating comment content from relationships. For example, a user creates a comment within a discussion thread.

Key relationships: Connects to discussion_board_users (author), discussion_board_discussions (context), and discussion_board_comment_replies (children). Special behaviors: Content limited to 5000 chars per business rules, auto-generated timestamps.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: [Unique comment ID] - Auto-generated identifier for each comment instance. Ensures uniqueness across all comment records in the system.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: [Author relationship] - Links to the user who created this comment. Implements user account requirements for tracking ownership.
- `discussion_board_discussion_id`: [Thread context] - Associates the comment with its parent discussion thread. Connects to the structured discussion framework.
- `content`: [Comment text] - Contains the actual content created by the user. Implements content creation rules including length restrictions.
- `created_at`: [Creation timestamp] - Records when the comment was first created. Used for moderation timelines and activity analysis.
- `updated_at`: [Last modification timestamp] - Tracks when the comment was last edited. Required for version history and audit trails.

## Voting

```mermaid
}

  String discussion_board_user_id FK
  DateTime created_at
  String ip_analysis
  Int positive_feedback_count
  Int negative_feedback_count
  Float rating
  String tags "nullable"
  String subject_id
  String subject_type
}
```

### `discussion_board_user_reputation`

User Reputation Model with 3NF compliance

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: Target user's `discussion_board_users.id`
- `up`: Whether the upvote was eventually approved
- `down`: Whether the downvote was eventually approved
- `initial_hit_detected`: Whether profanity was detected at initial submission
- `update_count`: Number of times this vote was updated
- `reputation_score`: Calculated reputation score

### `discussion_board_upvotes`

Upvotes tracking model with subject references

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: Target user's {\link discussion_board_users.id}
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp
- `ip_address`: Client IP address
- `flagged`: Automated moderation flag
- `report_count`: Report count
- `status`: Vote visibility status
- `moderation_reason`: Moderation priority reason
- `complexity`: Moderation complexity level
- `subject_id`: UUID of referenced subject
- `subject_type`: Type of referenced subject

### `discussion_board_downvotes`

[Downvotes tracking model with subject references] - Implements enterprise-grade moderation controls and privilege segmentation.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: Targeted user's {\link discussion_board_users.id}
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp
- `ip_analysis`: IP tracking analysis result
- `positive_feedback_count`: Positive vote count
- `negative_feedback_count`: Negative vote count
- `rating`: User rating tracking
- `tags`: Vote quality assurance tags
- `subject_id`: UUID of referenced subject
- `subject_type`: Type of referenced subject

## Moderation

```mermaid
erDiagram
"discussion_board_reports" {
  String id PK
  String reported_by_id FK "nullable"
  String moderated_by_id FK
  String target_discussion_id FK,UK "nullable"
  String target_comment_id FK,UK "nullable"
```

### `discussion_board_reports`

User-submitted content reports requiring moderator action. Implements business rules 4.Content Creation Rules (profanity detection) and 5.User Interaction Rules (report escalation). Maintains 3NF compliance by removing multiple reporting instances in favor of consolidated report cases with rich metadata. For example, when content is flagged by a user, the system creates an entry here with content extracts.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary key
- `reported_by_id`: Target user's {\link discussion_board_users.id}
- `moderated_by_id`: Chief moderator taking final action on this case
- `target_discussion_id`: Target discussion when the report involves a whole discussion
- `target_comment_id`: Target comment when the report involves a single discussion comment
- `auto_flagged`: Whether auto-flagging from content filters was triggered
- `content_created_at`: Post/Comment creation timestamp from the reported content
- `content_extract`: Extracted text content of the reported item for immediate analysis
- `report_created_at`: Creation timestamp of the report that triggered the moderation action
- `context_description`: Full context description when available (e.g., screenshot/explanation)
- `closed_at`: Closure timestamp of the report case
- `duplicate_count`: Number of duplicate reports for this content from multiple users

### `discussion_board_moderation_queue`

Moderation task priorities tracking with SLA enforcement. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (3-flag threshold for content hiding) and system reliability requirements (99.95% moderation history integrity). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating metric tracking from raw reporting data. For example, when a post gets flagged 3 times, this entry creates the appropriate SLA tracking context.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary key
- `discussion_report_id`: Original report triggering this moderation case
- `case_rank`: Auto-prioritized case rank score (0-100)
- `updated_at`: Last status update timestamp
- `urgent_reason`: Priority reason for system-urgent marking
- `escalated`: Whether repeated moderator inactivity requires escalated handling
- `similarity_analysis`: Analysis of content similarity to previously moderated items
- `moderation_hours`: Number of hours spent on case from first moderation action
- `resolution_deadline`: Estimated resolution deadline based on SLA

### `discussion_board_banned_users`

Banned user tracking model

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `banned_user_id`: Banned user's `discussion_board_users.id`
- `banned_at`: Banning time
- `display_name`: Display name for identification
- `recovery_code`: Recovery reference code
- `phone`: Contact phone number
- `reason_timestamp`: Ban reason timestamp
- `last_login`: Last login time

### `discussion_board_moderation_rules`

Automated moderation rule configurations with version history. Implements business rule 5.Content Moderation Rules (creation workflow), non-functional security requirements (SOC 2 compliance through version tracking), and technical specifications (500 character limit enforcement). Maintains 3NF compliance by separating policy rules from their technical implementation. For example, when configuring automated moderation rules per category.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary key
- `created_by_admin_id`: Creation system administrator
- `modified_by_admin_id`: Last modification administrator
- `rule_name`: Rule title (displayed in UI)
- `rule_description`: Rule description (detailed explanation)
- `rule_category`: Rule type category (profanity/content/pattern)
- `activated_at`: Rule activation timestamp
- `expires_at`: Permanent or temporary expiration
- `sensitivity`: Rule sensitivity level (0.0-1.0)
- `requires_review`: Whether rule requires manual review of flags
- `prevents_post`: Whether rule blocks content prior to posting
- `action_code`: Automated action instruction code
- `system_rule`: Whether this is a system-generated pattern rule

### `discussion_board_user_activity`

User activity tracking model

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `discussion_board_user_id`: Target user's {\link discussion_board_users.id}
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp
- `activity_type`: Type of activity
- `action_count`: Count of actions

### `discussion_board_user_patterns`

User behavior pattern detection - This implements business rules about patterned abuse detection and warning system.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `user_id`: User's [discussion_board_users.id](#discussion_board_users) - Implements user pattern mapping for rule-based enforcement.
- `activity_id`: Reference to triggering activity record - Implements traceability requirements for pattern analysis.
- `created_at`: Pattern detection timestamp - Implements system traceability requirements for audit trail purposes.
- `pattern_type`: Type of pattern detected - Implements behavioral detection requirements from moderation policies.
- `confidence_score`: System's confidence in this pattern detection - Implements two-factor authentication baseline requirements for moderation decisions.
- `trigger_count`: Number of pattern triggers in rolling window - Implements threshold-based enforcement requirements.
